metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: Application Control
clauses.rationale: CM-07(4) application allowlisting; CM-07(5) authorized software; CM-11 user-installed software restrictions.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 application allowlisting controls align well with ASD Essential Eight application control.

clauses.title: Application control - Maturity Level 1: Prevent execution of unapproved executables on workstations
clauses.rationale: CM-07(4)/(5) application allowlisting directly covers ML1 requirements.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Application control - Maturity Level 2: Extend to all user-facing systems; logging of blocked attempts
clauses.rationale: CM-07(4)/(5) application allowlisting; AU-02/AU-03 logging of security events.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ASD E8 ML2 requires specific logging of blocked execution attempts and coverage of internet-facing servers.

clauses.title: Application control - Maturity Level 3: Microsoft's recommended block rules, WDAC, driver control
clauses.rationale: CM-07(4)/(5) application allowlisting covers the concept.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML3 specifies Microsoft-specific implementation (WDAC, recommended block lists, driver control). SP 800-53 is technology-neutral and doesn't specify Microsoft implementations.

clauses.title: Patch Applications
clauses.rationale: SI-02 flaw remediation with automated mechanisms; RA-05 vulnerability scanning.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 patching controls align well with ASD Essential Eight application patching.

clauses.title: Patch Applications - ML1: Patch internet-facing services within 2 weeks; scanners within 48 hours
clauses.rationale: SI-02 flaw remediation; RA-05 vulnerability scanning.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML1 specifies patch timeframes (48 hours for critical vulnerabilities, 2 weeks for internet-facing). SP 800-53 requires timely patching but doesn't specify these timeframes.

clauses.title: Patch Applications - ML2: Patch within 48 hours for exploited vulnerabilities
clauses.rationale: SI-02 with automated patching; RA-05 vulnerability scanning.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML2 specifies 48-hour patching for exploited vulnerabilities. SP 800-53 supports timely patching but specific timelines are organization-defined.

clauses.title: Patch Applications - ML3: Automated asset discovery and patch coverage
clauses.rationale: SI-02(1) automated patching; CM-08(1) automated discovery; RA-05(2) update vulnerability database.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ASD E8 ML3 requires automated patch compliance reporting. SP 800-53 covers automated mechanisms.

clauses.title: Configure Microsoft Office Macro Settings
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality; CM-06 configuration settings; SI-03 malware protection.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 specifically addresses Microsoft Office macros. SP 800-53 covers application configuration generally but macro-specific controls are technology-specific. SC-18 (mobile code) is partially relevant.

clauses.title: Macros - ML1: Disable macros for users who don't require them
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality supports disabling unnecessary features; CM-06 configuration settings.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML1 specifies macro disablement. SP 800-53 supports through general configuration controls but Office macro-specific guidance not provided.

clauses.title: Macros - ML2: Block macros from the internet, antivirus scanning of macros
clauses.rationale: CM-07 configuration; SI-03 malware scanning; SC-18 mobile code.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML2 specifies blocking internet-originated macros and AV scanning. SP 800-53 covers malware protection generally.

clauses.title: Macros - ML3: Only signed macros from trusted publishers
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality; CM-06 configuration; SI-07 integrity verification.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML3 specifies trusted publisher macro signing. SP 800-53 covers integrity verification generally but macro signing policy is technology-specific.

clauses.title: User Application Hardening
clauses.rationale: CM-06 configuration settings; CM-07 least functionality; SC-18 mobile code restrictions.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ASD E8 specifically addresses web browser hardening, blocking ads/Java/Flash. SP 800-53 covers application configuration generally.

clauses.title: App Hardening - ML1: Block Flash, ads, Java in browsers; disable unneeded features
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality; CM-06 settings; SC-18 mobile code.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML1 specifies browser hardening. SP 800-53 covers through general configuration controls.

clauses.title: App Hardening - ML2: Disable PowerShell 2.0, constrained language mode
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality; CM-06 configuration settings.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML2 specifies PowerShell constraints. SP 800-53 covers least functionality generally but scripting engine restrictions are technology-specific.

clauses.title: App Hardening - ML3: .NET Framework 3.5 removal, PowerShell constrained mode, WDAC enforcement
clauses.rationale: CM-07 least functionality; CM-06 configuration.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML3 specifies Windows-specific hardening. SP 800-53 is technology-neutral; Microsoft-specific hardening guidance not provided.

clauses.title: Restrict Administrative Privileges
clauses.rationale: AC-06 least privilege with comprehensive enhancements; AC-02 account management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 least privilege controls align well with ASD Essential Eight admin privilege restriction.

clauses.title: Admin Privileges - ML1: Restrict privileged access to admin tasks
clauses.rationale: AC-06 least privilege; AC-06(5) privileged accounts; AC-02 account management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Admin Privileges - ML2: Separate admin workstations, no internet/email from privileged accounts
clauses.rationale: AC-06(2) non-privileged access for non-security functions; SC-07 boundary protection; AC-02 account management.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML2 requires privileged access workstations (PAWs) and internet restrictions. SP 800-53 supports through privilege and boundary controls but PAW concept is implementation-specific.

clauses.title: Admin Privileges - ML3: JIT admin, credential guard, block privileged account internet access
clauses.rationale: AC-06 least privilege; AC-02(6) dynamic privilege management; IA-05 credential management.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML3 specifies just-in-time administration and credential guard. SP 800-53 covers dynamic access and credential management but JIT and Credential Guard are implementation-specific.

clauses.title: Patch Operating Systems
clauses.rationale: SI-02 flaw remediation; SI-02(1) automated mechanisms; RA-05 vulnerability scanning; SA-22 unsupported components.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ASD E8 specifies OS patching timeframes (48 hours for critical). SP 800-53 requires timely patching but timeframes are organization-defined.

clauses.title: Patch OS - ML1: Patch internet-facing OS within 2 weeks
clauses.rationale: SI-02 flaw remediation; RA-05 vulnerability scanning.
clauses.gaps: ASD specifies 2-week timeframe. SP 800-53 requires timely remediation without specific timeframe.

clauses.title: Patch OS - ML2: Patch within 48 hours for exploited vulnerabilities
clauses.rationale: SI-02 with automated remediation mechanisms.
clauses.gaps: ASD specifies 48-hour timeframe for exploited vulnerabilities. SP 800-53 timeframes are organization-defined.

clauses.title: Patch OS - ML3: Latest OS versions, automated patch compliance
clauses.rationale: SI-02(1) automated patching; SA-22 unsupported components; CM-08(1) automated inventory.
clauses.gaps: ASD ML3 requires latest/previous OS versions only. SA-22 covers unsupported components similarly.

clauses.title: Multi-factor Authentication
clauses.rationale: IA-02(1)/(2) MFA for privileged/non-privileged; IA-02(6) network access; IA-05 authenticator management.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 MFA controls align well with ASD Essential Eight MFA requirements.

clauses.title: MFA - ML1: MFA for internet-facing services
clauses.rationale: IA-02(1)/(2) MFA for accounts accessing systems.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ASD E8 ML1 specifically targets internet-facing services. SP 800-53 covers MFA generally.

clauses.title: MFA - ML2: MFA for all privileged access and important data repositories
clauses.rationale: IA-02(1) MFA for privileged; AC-17 remote access.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ASD E8 ML2 requires MFA for important data repositories. SP 800-53 covers through general MFA and access controls.

clauses.title: MFA - ML3: Phishing-resistant MFA (FIDO2, smart cards)
clauses.rationale: IA-02(1) MFA; IA-02(12) acceptance of PIV credentials.
clauses.gaps: ASD E8 ML3 specifies phishing-resistant authenticators. SP 800-53 supports through MFA and PIV controls but phishing resistance as a specific requirement is implementation-dependent.

clauses.title: Regular Backups
clauses.rationale: CP-09 system backup; CP-06 alternate storage; CP-10 recovery; CP-09(1) testing for reliability.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 backup controls align well with ASD Essential Eight backup requirements.

clauses.title: Backups - ML1: Backups of important data, software, configuration settings
clauses.rationale: CP-09 directly covers backup of data, software, and configurations.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap.

clauses.title: Backups - ML2: Backups stored disconnected, backup restoration tested
clauses.rationale: CP-09 backup; CP-06 alternate storage; CP-09(1) testing restoration.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ASD E8 ML2 requires offline/disconnected backup copies. CP-06 alternate storage covers but offline specifically is less explicit.

clauses.title: Backups - ML3: Unprivileged accounts cannot modify/delete backups
clauses.rationale: CP-09 backup with protection; AC-06 least privilege; AC-03 access enforcement.
clauses.gaps: Minor: ASD E8 ML3 specifically addresses backup privilege separation. SP 800-53 covers through access control.
